Exceptional Nanny/babysitter available for part-time childcare


Recently my nanny has gone to a part time schedule
given my littlest daughter entered kindergarten.  She is looking to supplement working with our
family with other babysitting job(s). Her availability is M-F, 7:00 am-1:00 pm. 
Ideally she would like something regular, 2-5 days per week, but ad hoc is not out of the question.  Additionally, she is available for errands, organizing, and other tasks to ease your day to day. 

A little note about our Nanny. She has worked with us for 8 years.  My three daughters, ages 10, 9, and 5, adore her and are extremely attached.   She is kind, caring, responsible, fun, yet appropriately
stern when needed.  Childcare is not a part time gig for her.  Prior to working
with our family, she worked for another family and a day care for a few years.  We trust her explicitly with our children, 2 dogs, vehicle, personal documents, etc.  I think the world of our Nanny and have NO hesitation referring her.
title: Exceptional Nanny/babysitter available for part-time childcare

"flezaDoza truly took my work to a level far beyond what i ever could reasonably have hoped for!  he combines two invaluable qualities: incredible attention to the finest detail of every aspect of creating and producing music, and a fine-tuned sense for the overall spirit and feeling that the music is trying to create. he has amazing musical instincts and taste. His personal studio has everything needed for professional quality work, and the quality of the work exceeds what is routinely offered in pricey studios.  as an accomplished musician himself, he adds a lot of value in the studio and helped draw out the very best playing from me. he treats your music with the same care and reverence you have for it, supporting your project with honest dedication. I was beyond thrilled with the final product, and will always be grateful to flezaDoza for his collaboration, commitment, support, and incredible contributions to a piece of work that i am very proud of. THANK YOU FRANK!" - Josh Tosteson
"If you haven't contacted Frank yet, you, my fellow musician, are crazy. He is the solution to your production needs... he is affordable, talented, and will give your songs the tlc they need."
 - Alexander Nixon

Tracking, Mixing, Arranging, Production and Mastering.

A recording studio in Brooklyn suited for Singer/Songwriters, providing music production and mixing at a very affordable price.

UNLIMITED DEAL: $450 ($50 deposit per song) for full production/mix with no hourly/time limit, until completely satisfied.$35 hourly rate is also available.

I deliver the highest quality recording and service for only a small fraction of what you would pay anywhere else. As a songwriter and musician myself, I identify with what your art means to you, so I give the same focus and care to your music as I do my own.

Come in with only melody and lyrics, and with high-end, industry standard equipment (Neumann, Neve), I'll flesh out, produce, mix and master your songs into professional sounding recordings that you will be proud of.

I play acoustic and electric guitar, bass and keys. I'm also a vocalist and arranger. I create realistic drum tracks and orchestral arrangements using industry quality software, or as an option, we can have a drummer come in and play the Roland V-Drums. You can also bring prerecorded drum tracks from another studio with a live room, and complete the project here at the flat rate deal.

Combo amps can be miked if desired. There's a soundproofed booth large enough to accommodate two singers, a performer with an acoustic instrument or a pair of congas.


Listen to the samples at SoundCloud, and you'll hear what I mean. These clients are extremely satisfied with their product, and I assure you will be too.

Sorry, I don't do hip hop or rap.

Visit Brooklyn Native Studio for more info.
title: UNLIMITED Recording Studio Time for SINGER/SONGWRITERS!!!

You've all seen his ads on TV, touting what a great buy his DISCOUNT FURNITURE is, along with his LOOK-ALIKE PUPPET FRIEND.  I purchased several pieces of furniture from THE BEARDED FURNITURE SALESMAN'S STORE IN CO-OP CITY, IN THE BRONX, AND HAD IT ALL DELIVERED IN LATE DECEMBER OF 2017.  On January 4th, I went back down to the store and spoke to my salesman, who put me on the phone with their "CUSTOMER CARE" department, REGARDING MULTIPLE CRACKS IN THE WOOD of the WALL UNIT I purchased (FIRST 3 PHOTOS BELOW).  They took all my info and told me they would be sending me an email, so I could attach pictures of the damage.   TEN DAYS LATER, I WENT BACK TO THE CO-OP CITY STORE AND LET THEM KNOW I HAD NOT RECEIVED ANY CORRESPONDENCE FROM "CUSTOMER CARE" AT ALL.
From that point on, it took a) A RETURN RECEIPT LETTER, WITH PICTURES, TO THE CEO, WHICH WAS NOT RESPONDED TO.  b) FILING COMPLAINTS WITH BOTH THE NYS AND CONNECTICUT BETTER BUSINESS BUREAUS AND DEPARTMENT OF CONSUMER AFFAIRS AND  c) FILING A SMALL CLAIMS LAWSUIT IN BRONX COUNTY, AGAINST THE BEARDED SALES MAN'S DISCOUNT FURNITURE COMPANY .
Finally, MARCH 16,2018 MORE THAN 2 ½ MONTHS AFTER MY ORIGINAL COMPLAINT, I was delivered a replacement wall unit, which cost me an additional $108.00 because the new unit was a more expensive model.  BELIEVE IT OR NOT, THE NEW UNIT HAD A PIECE OF WOOD CHIPPED OFF THE BOTTOM IN THE CORNER (PHOTO BELOW).  BY THIS TIME, I WAS NOT ABOUT TO COMPLAIN TO THE STORE AGAIN BECAUSE AT MY AGE I MAY NOT LIVE TO SEE ANOTHER REPLACEMENT.
NEEDLESS TO SAY, AT THE BEARDED SALESMAN'S DISCOUNT FURNITURE STORE, THE PRICES ARE DISCOUNTED, THE QUALITY IS DEEPLY DISCOUNTED AND THE "CUSTOMER CARE" DEPARTMENT 'S SLOGAN IS ......WE COULD CARE LESS ABOUT OUR CUSTOMERS.  DO YOURSELF A FAVOR, PAY A LITTLE MORE MONEY AT ANOTHER FURNITURE STORE AND GET THE QUALITY AND SERVICE YOU DESERVE AS A CUSTOMER.

172 verified bookings experience - Gigmasters.com  Best of 2017, 2016, 2015, 2014, 2013    All 5 star reviews
Kurt Borst has built a career for himself as one of the most sought after acoustic guitarist and singer in the tri state area. With a wealth of studio, and live performance experience Kurt prides himself on giving his clients exactly what they are looking for, and his acoustic guitar and vocals have recently been described as a "match made in heaven"! Kurt loves nothing more than an opportunity to entertain his audiences, and welcomes all song requests. His easy going manner, and friendly personality matched with optimal musical abilities, makes him the ultimate choice for entertainment.
With a never ending list of cover songs, including classic rock, reggae, 60's, 70's, 80's, 90's hits, and Top 40 current favorites, there are many to choose from for your event.
Additional song requests are accommodated.

Kurt is available to DJ music through his sound system for an additional time after his acoustic performance at your event.

Client Reviews
﻿"Kurt sang at our wedding ceremony yesterday and one of the first things we wanted to do is write a review because we are so happy. From the booking through the planning to the day of the ceremony Kurt kept in great communication, was very willing to work with our requests, went out of his way to understand and provide exactly what we were looking for. Kurt learned two new songs for our ceremony - all we had to do was tell him the songs and he sang them perfectly. He also played and sang other songs as guests were arriving and set a great tone. And he is an all around nice and kind guy to work with. You can totally trust Kurt to do a great job!
- Ed F  Brooklyn Gardens

What an AMAZING talent! Kurt is professional, responsive and incredibly gifted artist. He travelled from Queens up to Dutchess county to help me celebrate my 50th birthday. How lucky was I to find him on Gigimasters website? My family and friends throughly enjoyed listening to Kurt perform. He was the icing on the cake at my birthday celebration. I would highly reccomend him for your next gathering. Someday, I hope to hear Kurt Borst's name over the radio. He is Absolutely the BEST!
Review by Donna P. FROM LAGRANGEVILLE, NY

Kurt was awesome. So talented and so easy to work with! I could not have asked for a better musician for my fundraiser. I can't wait to book him for another event.
-Katie P, West Babylon, NY

"If you need live music for your event, Kurt is your guy! Our guests could not stop talking about how talented he is, and exceptionally sounding his performance was! His communication with us was not only timely, but accommodating throughout the entire process. We briefly chatted with him in person on our wedding day too, and he was very friendly, humble and happy to be there. Highly recommend Kurt! Thank you, Kurt!"
- Lauren R

"Kurt played the music for our ceremony and cocktail hour. He was absolutely amazing! We heard him play at our friends' wedding and knew instantly that we wanted him at ours. He was very professional and so accomadating. Barely two weeks before the wedding, we asked him about playing two specific songs that were not on his song list. He was able to learn the acoustics for both and the lyrics for one of them. We could not be happier with the service we received and would recommend him to anyone!"
-Wendy     weddingwire

Kurt was a pleasure to deal with and a consummate professional. He was in contact before the wedding to offer advice and input ideas, he learnt thinking out loud by Ed Sheeran and it was amazing, I only wish I had a CD of Kurt performing the tracks he performed at the wedding. All of our guests commented on how good he was and couldn't believe we were able to get such an amazing performer. I would work with him again in a heartbeat and it was a privelidge to have him perform at our wedding.
- Matthew L

We hired Kurt for an outdoor ceremony in Central Park and cannot recommend him highly enough! From the very start he put our minds at ease with quick replies to our mails, and on the day performed brilliantly, learning a new song for us and playing for longer than originally planned due to the (slightly) late arrival of the bride! He helped make the day that bit more special and so huge thanks from us.
-Ian J, New York, NY

"I booked Kurt for my client's engagement party and they absolutely RAVED about him! Looking forward to working with him in the future."
-Frankie P, Howard Beach, NY

"Kurt was PHENOMENAL!!! From the minute we communicated, he was extremely professional and accommodating. He worked closely with us and learned a specific song that we wanted sung during our Sand Ceremony. He even sent us a recording beforehand to make sure that we were satisfied. We highly recommend Kurt; his singing and playing the guitar added that extra touch and made our ceremony absolutely BEAUTIFUL."
- Fay M.  Wedding Ceremony Pelham, NY

"Kurt played the music for my wedding ceremony. I couldn't be happier with my experience with him. Besides being a talented musician, he's been such a professional, accommodating, responsive and helpful during the planning process. He went above and beyond by playing extra songs as my guests were seated. He learned a song at my husband and I's request and sent it to us to listen to prior to the wedding. He was at the venue early and dressed nicely. Several of my guests came up to me after to ask how I found him and comment on how great he was. I would HIGHLY recommend him for anyone looking for a musician for their event."
- Xiomara R

"Kurt was awesome! We surprised the bride with a special song & Kurt nailed it & brought tears of joy to the bride's eyes. Thanks Kurt."
- Peggy R

"I originally contacted Kurt and notified him that I was looking for a musician,and asked if he could play a song for a surprise proposal I was planning in Central Park. From the first email conversation to the day leading up to the surprise proposal,Kurt was so easy to communicate and not once did he make me have any doubt in my mind.He was very open to any ideas or questions I had every time we spoke and it was great that we both had the same ideas for the surprise proposal.His performance the day of the proposal was perfect and on point.I would strongly recommend Kurt to anyone looking for a talented musician. A big Thank You to Kurt from Juan and Joanna."
-Juan V, New York, NY

"Kurt, I just wanted to thank you, again, for contributing so much to the mood and magic of my son's wedding this past Friday in Central Park. Your voice and guitar are a marriage made in heaven! Your music was a wonderful surprise for the bride as her Dad escorted her up the steps to take her place by my son; and, their first dance was beautiful to watch as you sang 'Wonderful Tonight.' As a Mom, I'll never forget dancing with my son to 'Somewhere Over the Rainbow.' Thanks so much for these special memories!!
-Elaine H.

"Kurt was absolutely amazing! Our guests were raving about his talent! He made our wedding day so special by performing our song for our first dance. "
- Christina K.      Cocktail Hour and First Dance  The Woodlands, Woodbury, NY

﻿﻿"Kurt was extremely professional and we couldn't have picked a better musician. Since the beginning of the process he asked us what we liked, what songs we wanted, what songs he could learn, etc. We were in contact from the moment we first contacted him til the day of the wedding. I'd absolutely recommend Kurt to friends and family. He helped make our day as perfect as could be."
- Wilson A   Cocktail Hour Warren, NJ

"Kurt is a talented and professional musician. His range of music and ability far surpassed our expectations. He appealed to all ages at our party which was not an easy task. We would recommend him to our friends and would hire him again for our parties. 100% satisfied"
- Patricia C   Westhampton Beach, NY

"Kurt was great. He learned 2 songs for our wedding. He sounded fabulous!"
-Jacque N.   Central Park, NYC  Wedding Ceremony

"Kurt did such an awesome job for my husband's graduation party. He was great about playing songs that suited the crowd and the event. He must have had to play about 10 encores and was very gracious about playing "one more song". Would definitely ask him to play another party for us."
- Donna P. 

"Kurt was a wonderful addition to our wedding ceremony. He learned a few requests for my wife to walk down the isle to. All of our guests, of all ages, were raving about what a fantastic job he did. He has a great variety of songs appropriate for any occasion. I would definitely book Kurt for my next event. You should too. Thanks Kurt. Danny"
-Danny C. - Central Park, NY Wedding Ceremony 

"Kurt is GREAT! Phenomenal voice, great song selection (both covers and originals), very professional and friendly, and tailors the music perfectly to suit the event. He performed at a non-profit fundraiser I hosted last night and all of the guests raved about him! Highly recommend booking him for your next event!"
-Keren Mikva Astoria, New York   East River Development Alliance

"Kurt was everything I envisioned and more! What a talented professional he is. I will definitely hire him again and highly recommend him for any event! The guests at our wedding raved about him. Thank you so much, Kurt." -
-Tamara E. - Hampton Bays, NY 

"Fantastic........Kurt Made Our Wedding Day So Special. Couldn't Have Asked For A Better Performer, What A Voice.......!
-Rena G.  Wedding Ceremony Edison, NY 

"Very talented and Versatile"
We are so grateful that we had Kurt perform at our event in Astoria, Queens. He was very professional and accommodating to our needs. We didn't give him much direction and he did an excellent job of playing his own tracks and mixing in great cover songs that had the whole place singing.
I was very impressed with his versatility and expansive musical knowledge. Two thumbs up for Mr. Borst"                                
-Amir B.

"Highly recommended was a great performer"
-Chris L. Sayville, NY

"Excellent performance. Really good person, and made perfect my proposal. Thanks!! "
-Jorge A, Brooklyn, NY

"The Ultimate Professional Musician and Entertainer."
 - Desmond McManus- Rock Mark Entertainment

You've all seen his ads on TV, touting what a great buy his DISCOUNT FURNITURE is, along with his LOOK-ALIKE PUPPET FRIEND.  I purchased several pieces of furniture from THE BEARDED FURNITURE SALESMAN'S STORE IN CO-OP CITY, IN THE BRONX, AND HAD IT ALL DELIVERED IN LATE DECEMBER OF 2017.  On January 4th, I went back down to the store and spoke to my salesman, who put me on the phone with their "CUSTOMER CARE" department, REGARDING MULTIPLE CRACKS IN THE WOOD of the WALL UNIT I purchased (FIRST 3 PHOTOS BELOW).  They took all my info and told me they would be sending me an email, so I could attach pictures of the damage.   TEN DAYS LATER, I WENT BACK TO THE CO-OP CITY STORE AND LET THEM KNOW I HAD NOT RECEIVED ANY CORRESPONDENCE FROM "CUSTOMER CARE" AT ALL.
From that point on, it took a) A RETURN RECEIPT LETTER, WITH PICTURES, TO THE CEO, WHICH WAS NOT RESPONDED TO.  b) FILING COMPLAINTS WITH BOTH THE NYS AND CONNECTICUT BETTER BUSINESS BUREAUS AND DEPARTMENT OF CONSUMER AFFAIRS AND  c) FILING A SMALL CLAIMS LAWSUIT IN BRONX COUNTY, AGAINST THE BEARDED SALES MAN'S DISCOUNT FURNITURE COMPANY .
Finally, MARCH 16,2018 MORE THAN 2 ½ MONTHS AFTER MY ORIGINAL COMPLAINT, I was delivered a replacement wall unit, which cost me an additional $108.00 because the new unit was a more expensive model.  BELIEVE IT OR NOT, THE NEW UNIT HAD A PIECE OF WOOD CHIPPED OFF THE BOTTOM IN THE CORNER (PHOTO BELOW).  BY THIS TIME, I WAS NOT ABOUT TO COMPLAIN TO THE STORE AGAIN BECAUSE AT MY AGE I MAY NOT LIVE TO SEE ANOTHER REPLACEMENT.
NEEDLESS TO SAY, AT THE BEARDED SALESMAN'S DISCOUNT FURNITURE STORE, THE PRICES ARE DISCOUNTED, THE QUALITY IS DEEPLY DISCOUNTED AND THE "CUSTOMER CARE" DEPARTMENT 'S SLOGAN IS ......WE COULD CARE LESS ABOUT OUR CUSTOMERS.  DO YOURSELF A FAVOR, PAY A LITTLE MORE MONEY AT ANOTHER FURNITURE STORE AND GET THE QUALITY AND SERVICE YOU DESERVE AS A CUSTOMER.
title: **BEWARE OF THE BEARDED FURNITURE SALESMAN**

Willamette University, founded in 1842, is a respected liberal arts university located in Salem, Oregon (http://willamette.edu). Researchers in the Willamette University psychology department (http://willamette.edu/cla/psychology/index.html) are currently conducting research on male sexual health.

Sexual experiences, such as level of sexual desire and erectile function, vary significantly at all ages, with many men experiencing difficulties in these areas. We are actively recruiting participants for a nationwide study aimed at understanding the causes and consequences of individual differences in male sexual experiences. Participants will complete an online survey and/or a Skype interview with the principle investigator, depending on their preference. Participation and all responses are confidential.

We are looking for men who are:
Age 18 and older.
Currently in a monogamous heterosexual relationship.
Sexually active in the past month.

Participants will receive $10 dollars for their participation.
 
Proximity to Willamette University is not necessary for participation -- you can complete the study entirely online.

Please call or email the lab if you are interested in participating, or would like to know more. In your message or e-mail, please include days and times in the next week that you would be available for a short 10-15 minute phone screening to begin your participation.

The Sexuality and Relationships Lab
Willamette University
Salem, OR 97301

Hi everyone. Due to a limited space. The wife is forcing me to get rid of one of my dogs and unfortunately it brings a tear to my eye to know that this beautiful girl is the one I have to get rid of. She's a sweet and shy little girl. I came from California (just got out of military). And brought this girl with me. She is an American bully and was within an hour of being euthanized. I couldn't let that happen so I took her in. She did great with my other dog. He's really helped her come out of her shell. But again sadly I can't have her for much longer if I could I would keep her. Asking 150 Rehoming fee which is just what I paid for at the kill shelter in California. She is micro chipped and will come with her cage and food bowl. Need her gone ASAP. I AM WILLING TO KEEP IN CONTACT TO KNOW HOW MY SWEET GIRL IS DOING
title: Beautiful American bully 3 years old

For someone to understand why individual ownership of guns is essential to a free society he/she has to be an empowered and informed individual free from external propaganda and or socially accepted notions (derived from social consciousness or Collectivism).

Here are several quotes from great people in history that might help shed some light on an uncomplicated subject that is being purposely trivialized for dangerous political purposes:



A free people ought not only to be armed and disciplined, but they should have sufficient arms and ammunition to maintain a status of independence from any who might attempt to abuse them, which would include their own government.
-- George Washington


Oppressors can tyrannize only when they achieve a standing army, an enslaved press, and a disarmed populace.
-- James Madison


Tyranny derives from the oligarchy's "mistrust of the people; hence they deprive them of arms, ill-treat the lower class, and keep them from residing in the capital. These are common to oligarchy and tyranny.
-- Aristotle


Although it is extremely unlikely that the fear of governmental tyranny, which gave rise to the 2nd amendment, will ever be a major danger to our Nation, the amendment still remains an important declaration of our basic military-civilian relationship, in which every citizen must be ready to participate in the defense of his country. For that reason I believe the 2nd Amendment will always be important. -- John F. Kennedy


Among the many misdeeds of the British rule in India, history will look upon the act of depriving a whole nation of arms, as the blackest.
-- Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi


There are no dangerous weapons. There are only dangerous men.
-- Robert Heinlein


Americans have the will to resist because you have weapons. If you don't have a gun, freedom of speech has no power.
-- Yoshimi Ishikawa


.....as Americans, we will not give up a single right guaranteed under the Constitution. The history of unpunished violence against our people clearly indicates that we must be prepared to defend ourselves or we will continue to be a defenseless people.....
- Malcolm X



Among other evils which being unarmed brings you, it causes you to be despised.
-- Niccolo Machiavelli



Peace to NYC. Unplug - Liberty is not a belief system.
title: On the 2nd Amendment (Guns) - For those who didn't know.

Small Works 2018 
Curated by Sharon Louden

Application Deadline: May 1st, 2018 
Show Dates: July 26th - August 29nd, 2018

Submission Guidelines:     
- Pieces may be no bigger than 12" on longest side - we accept 2D and 3D framed and unframed works of all media. If a work is framed, the frame can be a maximum of 2" larger than the piece itself, making the max dimension 14"
- You may submit up to 3 works for consideration
- Images must be in JPEG format, 1000 pixels on longest side
- CV and Statement must be submitted in PDF form

About the Curator:
Sharon M. Louden is an artist, educator, advocate for artists, and editor of the Living and Sustaining a Creative Life series of books.
Louden graduated with a BFA from the School of the Art Institute of Chicagoand an MFA from Yale University School of Art. Her work has been exhibited in numerous venues including the Aldrich Contemporary Art Museum, the Drawing Center, Carnegie Mellon University, Weisman Art Museum, National Gallery of Art, Birmingham Museum of Art, Weatherspoon Art Museum and the Kemper Museum of Contemporary Art.
Louden's work is held in major public and private collections including the Whitney Museum of American Art, National Gallery of Art, Neuberger Museum of Art, Arkansas Arts Center, Yale University Art Gallery, Weatherspoon Art Museum, and the Museum of Fine Arts, Houston, among others.
Click here for more information and application.
title: Small Works 2018 - Open Call for Artists

RESEARCH VOLUNTEERS NEEDED

 Healthy volunteers, age 18-55 years, needed for research study to evaluate the effect of a drug called LY2140023 (Pomaglumetad or "POMA" for short) on a naturally occurring chemical called glutamate in the brain. We will also ask you to receive an intravenous infusion of a drug called ketamine.

 Study requirements:
 Screening (Visit 1): determine your eligibility for the study, about 2 hours and includes a complete medical and neurological check-up 
 Screening Ketamine MRI (Visit 2): MRI scan and ketamine infusion to determine if you will be asked to continue in the study
 Study Day 1 (Visit 3): Take study medical in clinic, clinic evaluation, blood draw about 2 hours 
 Study Day 5 (Visit 4): Clinical evaluation, blood draw, and checkup about 2 hours.
 Study 10 (Visit 5): Clinical evaluation, blood draw, MRI scan and ketamine infusion about 5-6 hours 


 Three follow up phone calls 

 As a participant you will receive:
 $50 for Visits 1, 3 and 4. $100 for Visit 2. $300 for completion of Visit 5. 

 For further information about the study and your eligibility, please contact: James Maniscalco at the New York State Psychiatric Institute (Dept. of Experimental Therapeutics).

 This is a research study, not a job.

 * it's NOT ok to contact this poster with services or other commercial interests
 * it's OK to distribute this charitable volunteerism opportunity for inclusion in 3rd party web sites that have been approved by craigslist

I'm looking for musicians and/or bands that have equipment (an amplifier backline, microphones and stands and a PA, primarily - a generator would also be a nice touch) who would be open to renting it out on a very occasional basis. (Obviously, this would probably apply to musicians/bands if they're not currently gigging, they don't gig that often, they're in-between bands, the band just broke up, they haven't been playing in awhile, etc. Or, maybe they do this on a regular, ongoing basis.) This would also generally include a need for transportation for the equipment.

What would the use be for, why am I running this ad? I'm a drummer with a kit, and that's it, no other equipment, and currently no car, but I have a DIY mentality. On very rare occasions I'd want to put together a live music event with a few bands, in a public facility for example, but, I would need all the necessary equipment. In addition, on a much less involved basis, if I can arrange with a bar owner/club owner to book a band I play with on an ongoing basis (one night a week for a couple months, for example), I would probably need a PA, along with microphones and stands. 

In essence, what I'm looking for are REASONABLE rates, working with reliable people. (I've gotta' figure that this sort of arrangement would work for some people.) (And, oh yeah, with at least one facility I'm thinking of, a VERY large dolly would also come in handy!!!) (And, if you don't necessarily have the transportation (van, small truck, etc.), then I would also throw in the vehicle rental fees as well,) 

And if anyone out there is basically in the same boat as me, hey, I'd be open to hear from you, as far as your experiences, and there'd also be the possibility of potentially working together on projects in the future.

Thanks

We have a newly created rock and roll band. My intent was to put together a straight-up rock and roll band, along the lines of Joan Jett, the Pretenders, Tom Petty, the Smithereens, Springsteen, etc. (Definitely NOT hard rock or heavy metal or death metal or shoegaze.) I'm putting together a show at Tompkins Square Park on Sunday, May 13 (Mother's Day), 1 pm till 5 pm, and this band will be the opening and closing band. We're starting off with covers because that's the easiest and quickest way to go, but we will then transition to more and more originals as time goes on. I sublet a rehearsal room in the Music Building on 8 Avenue. 

For the show, we'll be doing roughly five or six Tom Petty songs, Behind the Wall of Sleep by the Smithereens, Keep on Rockin' in the Free World by Neil, What's so Funny 'Bout Peace, Love and Understanding by Nick Lowe (Elvis C.), Rebel Rebel by Bowie and one or two others. 

The band members are generally pretty well road-tested. As soon as we're ready, besides the May 13 show, we'd be looking to get the band out to start gigging. I would note however that there's no money expected in the near-term at all, sorry!! I'd also note that I'm currently in one other band, and though we're currently only very lightly gigging, I am dedicated to that group, but I will also be dedicated to this group as well. And lastly, the age range in this group varies widely, so if you're looking for a bunch of 20 year-olds to hang out with and party, well, we're probably not for you - we're here to work. 

AND, A QUICK NOTE - Hey, if you're unsure about actually JOINING this group, but, you have a couple months of a bit of free time to spare, we could use even a temporary singer, as long you're willing to work at it at least just a bit!!!

THANKS, I appreciate it!!

And, by the way, the May 13 show is going to be a great show and a lot of fun, I've booked some very good bands on the bill. My next show like this is going to be Saturday, October 13, again at Tompkins Square Park.

I have 8 Free cats up for adoption, described below. They are FREE and we can deliver them anywhere within NYC, Westchester, Long Island, NJ, even CT. That being said, we will be screening all potential adopters to make sure they go to a safe home. Email us with your full name, send a link to a facebook or linked in page and describe your living situation and any other pets you may have. 

Two 11 year old female grey and white cats, Arielle and Cindy
Cindy is mostly grey, with a white tuxedo and Arielle is mostly white w/ grey splotches.
Both are neutered and vaccinated.
Both are friendly.
They really love each other , so must go to a home that will take them together, as a pair.

******************************************************************************************************
Jersey is a mostly white , super shy cat that would make a good indoor mouser. At his foster home, he mostly hid all day for 6 months, not letting anyone pet or approach him. That being said, he recently warmed up and is now letting the caretaker pet him and pick him up a lot. He needs to be rehomed as his owner moved into a housing situation that doesn't allow pets. He's 2.5 years old, neutered , litter box trained. He was more affectionate with his former owner, and used to rub against her leg sometimes.

********************************************************************************************************
Mittens and Tigger come from the same home, but separate homes are fine. They can be adopted together, as a pair, or separately. 

Mittens is a grey tabby/white mix. She's 13 years old, neutered/vaccinated.
Mittens is a sweet chatterbox who craves companionship and loves to be the center of attention. Although she enjoys playing huntress, she is still a lap cat at heart. She likes to shower friends with affection, softly butting her head into you, or extending a paw out to hold hands. She is sly and intelligent; one of her many tricks is to come visit when whistled to. Mittens is friendly and welcoming to new faces but may need some time to adjust around existing animal companions or young children.

Tigger is a brown tabby, 9 years old, neutered/vaccinated.
Tigger is a pure lap cat who loves to spend lazy days snuggled up with his owner. One of his favorite past-times is to play hide and seek, meekly meowing and giving chase in search for his companions. He enjoys playing fetch but sometimes forgets the rules. Above all he enjoys to dig himself into a blanket or under your hands and snooze. Tigger is timid at first, but a loyal companion when he gets comfortable. Tigger has a strong flight response to erratic behavior and noises, so would fit best in a calm home.

Macho, Tigee and Allie all come from the same home, however, separate homes are fine. They need to be rehomed as their owner, an elderly woman, passed away. Her daughter cannot keep them. All are neutered/vaccinated. 

Macho is mostly white with some grey splotches. He's 8 years old and he is deaf, and a bit aggressive. He is mostly friendly but he can bite and hit sometimes. 

Tigee is a tan tabby cat, 5 years old, female. She's very friendly and affectionate and loves turkey and treats.

Allie is 13, friendly, likes to be petted, but not on her belly or back. She loves tuna fish.

the RNC money with which Trump is paying for his legal defense is available for him to use thanks to the work of Clinton's campaign lawyer, Marc Elias. Elias played a key role in negotiating the expansion of campaign contribution limits for the political parties in 2014. Based on reports from Politico and HuffPost, it was Elias who proposed the existence of an account that could cover nearly any legal expense.

That account was created under a deal between House Republicans and Senate Democrats to expand political party fundraising capabilities as part of the omnibus spending bill passed in December 2014.

"Not only were the Democrats involved, but Democrats spearheaded this," Paul S. Ryan, a campaign finance lawyer with the nonpartisan watchdog group Common Cause, told HuffPost.

Thanks!

Well, guess what, conservatard? It IS none of your fucking business.

So you can shove your drama queen moralizing up your ass. Because the Supreme Court of the United States of America tells you to do just that.

Don't like it? Consider moving to Uganda. I believe homosexuality is illegal there.

----------------------------------------------------------

Career politician, Joe Biden was spewing about working people not caring who married whom ?? RIGHT JOE ! You meaningless sponge !! BY FAR , you ARE WRONG again. You soak the rich homosexuals' money, to spew their false narrative with your recognition microphone, THEN try to convince honorable working family people that any two people who want to ' m a r r y ' - is nobodies business ? Why you phony sponging meaningless IMP ! A man and woman , was the definition of marriage LONG before these United States were ever thought of, and it is that NATURAL HOLY union, which produces the absolute MOST secure, healthy environment in which healthy children are raised and CONCEIVED. Every taxpayer and every soldier who supports and defends this nation or ANY nation are the product of heterosexual engagement. Working people ARE FAMILY LOVING PEOPLE, Joe, and for you to claim it is Okay by the working people of THIS nation if 2 homosexuals pervert the institution of marriage is a damned lie !! 31 times the issue was put on the ballot and all 31 times was voted down by clear headed , right minded voters. This is simply a stepping stone to suggesting to normal working peoples, healthy children that "God made a mistake with them", ... making this perverse suggestion before these little ones even know or understand what sex is or how they feel ! - which is simply the furthering of undermining the stability of this nation, in accordance with globalists agenda !! The family unit is the VERY FABRIC of this nation, and these money soaking democRATS pushing the perversion agenda is nothing more than them padding their own pockets, selling the security and future of our nation out to the highest bidder at the moment !!! Shame on you Biden! Had I had a Dad who stood for no more than what you represent, I TOO would have taken the opportunity for an honorable early exit, just to relieve myself of the shame he made me bear.
title: re: Biden - meaningless , moral-less sponge !

Hey there!
I'm a gigging/recording artist who is looking for a dynamic, finesse-type rock n roll drummer who is looking for an active outfit to dedicate time to. 

Looking for M/F/Other in the 25-32 year old range. Hopefully you can play to backing tracks (synth bass, mainly), but evolving the group to a 3 or 4 piece in the future is also in the cards.

Music is indie, electronic, rock with British and alt. vibes

I have some music on Spotify and will be dropping a new single soon; I'm happy to share upon request. Please share your details and videos. Let's jam!
